posts.title: Why the most honest health check happens at night
posts.excerpt: Sleep reveals signals you can’t feel while awake. Here’s how we turn them into clarity.
body: Sleep is when the body tells the truth. Breathing pauses, oxygen dips, and irregular rhythms often happen silently while we rest.
Our goal is to surface those signals in plain language and give you a simple morning brief you can act on.

posts.title: Pad + Ring: one system, two roles
posts.excerpt: Why we separate everyday monitoring from precision checks — and why that matters.
body: The pad is effortless and always on. The ring is for precision checks when you want deeper oxygen insights.
Together, they balance comfort and accuracy — which improves long‑term adherence for real families.

posts.title: Designing for families and caregivers
posts.excerpt: How we build a calmer experience for people who want clarity, not alarms.
body: We design for calm, not alarms. Families need clarity without disruption.
That’s why we focus on morning briefs, shared reports, and easy next steps.
